Experience HR Director Google November 2013  – Present (1 year 10 months) San Francisco Bay Area I am the HR Director for Product Quality Operations (PQO) at Google. PQO is a group of ~650 folks whose mission is to protect Google and increase user and partner trust by ensuring a safe and high quality product experience. As their business partner, I help them with all of the HR needs like staffing, performance management, compensation planning, exits, organizational planning, and learning and development. Director of Staffing Google December 2009  –  November 2013  (4 years) San Francisco Bay Area Currently managing a team of ~100 recruiters for Google's HR, Legal, Finance, Facilities, Corporate Communications, Public Policy, Business Operations, YouTube and other "autonomous units" like Google[x]. Since 2009, my team has hired 4500+ employees into Google. 
 
Responsibilities include workforce planning, metrics-based productivity improvements, liaising with executive clients, and all managerial aspects of running a 100 person team. People Analytics Manager Google 2007  –  December 2009  (2 years) San Francisco Bay Area Managed a team of 9 analysts within the People Analytics Team who conducted data analysis on recruiting, retention, employee satisfaction, performance appraisal, workforce planning. Research was used to help HR find, retrain, and grow the best people in the world. 
 
Presented results of metrics-based dashboards and ad-hoc analyses to executives up to and including the Founders and CEO on consistent basis (always quarterly, sometimes monthly). Staffing Programs Manager Google 2005  –  2007  (2 years) San Francisco Bay Area Created scientific hiring algorithm for key positions to predict high performance among applicants. Algorithms showed up to 20x better predictive power than legacied selection procedures. Project was profiled on front page of NYTimes on 1/7/2007. 
 
Constructed metric-based models of productivity for recruiters which were used to diagnose areas of lost productivity and ensure the staff were aligned with company-wide goals. Staffing Analyst Google 2004  –  2005  (1 year) San Francisco Bay Area Used Wisdom of Crowds methodology to reduce the average number of interviews from >9 per candidate down to 5, saving ~50,000 interviewing hours per year. Project was profiled in the Wall Street Journal on 10/23/2006. 
 
Created a higher education database from scratch which rated the quality of 23,000+ universities worldwide by combining rankings from 100+ objective sources, academic research, and the opinions of 200+ Googlers Consultant Right Management August 2002  –  April 2004  (1 year 9 months) The original company was called Terranova Consulting and was acquired by Right Management. 
 
Managed project work that included meeting with clients, writing proposals, developing budgets, observing employees on-the-job, developing questionnaires, leading focus groups, administering questionnaires, conferring with legal counsel, analyzing and interpreting data, and presenting results. 
 
Consulting in areas related to recruitment and selection strategies, job analysis, compliance with employment law, performance management, HR strategy alignment, competency development, training and development, and off-site facilitation.

Summary A career HR professional – a father, friend, coach, mentor, general athlete, program manager, problem solver and a start-up guy in the HR space ! Presently, Director and Head of Google People Services for Google, APAC. 
 
Previous roles at Google include managing a Program Management office for People Operations in the APAC region, focusing on People Ops Strategy and Operations and managing People Programs in India, a function focused on Employment Branding and Talent Outreach.  
 
DNP brings with him experience in Staffing, Staffing Process Re - engineering, Campus relations, hiring and Programs, Talent Planning & Research, HR Operations, Employee Engagement, Global Immigrations, Employment and Internal Branding, Internal Communications, HR Analytics and Diversity.He considers himself a “ start-up” Human Resources leader, for experience in setting up teams and functions, across country, region or a global scale.  
 
Before joining Google in August 2006, he was working as the Head, Global Entry Level Hiring and Campus Relations for Infosys Technologies Ltd. His experience includes Employee Relations, Immigrations and HR Operations, all of which he handled at various points in time of his career with Infosys; across India and United States. 
 
His interests include sports (formerly, national level Basketball player, coach and sports administrator), music and books (sports biographies is a pet read). 
 
He is passionate about mentoring and career coaching and is active on both fronts.  
 
DNP was chosen as and awarded the Best HR Leader in the Tenth Annual Singapore HRM Awards, 2013 – a pre-eminent HR Awards in Singapore, and featured as one of the best HR leaders to watch for in 2013, in a cover story by HRM Asia in the January 2013 issue. 
 
He serves on the HR Core Advisory Committee for NASSCOM - India, the HR Advisory team for SPRING, Singapore and on the Board of Management Studies of T.A. Pai Management Institute, Manipal – India.

People Programs Manager - Google India Google August 2006  –  December 2008  (2 years 5 months) Bengaluru Area, India Was responsible for managing People Programs for Google India. The role was pan-India in nature; my team (of 10) and I worked across businesses and locations in India. In sync with the mission of People Programs across Google, we anticipated the demands and meet the requirements of the company's rapid expansion throughout the world. The team helps Google's recruiting and HR processes work effectively and extol Google's many virtues as an employer.  
 
My role encompassed responsibilities in two broad paradigms, whose objectives are:  
 
1.	Build an Effective Employment Brand for Google India: Involved engagements across the following key functional areas: University Programs, Branding and Communication and Events / Conferences and Seminars.  
 
Conceptualize, design and execute: engagement plans with engineering and Non-Engineering Schools of choice; various sources of employment branding and communication that will provide a platform to promote / enhance Google employment brand. 
 
2.	Developed and managed programs for Google India People Ops: Programs are by nature organizational, functional or team specific. Mostly, these engagements happened in a cross-functional team within HR (and sometimes business); enables strengthening Program Management capabilities within People Ops, India.  
 
Often, my role involved playing a role of in internal consultant; to identify issues in staffing or HR, and work towards providing (and most times, executing) immediate problem solving measures and long term solutions.
